授業目的: Extending the course ‘Introduction to European Economic History’ that ends with a class on the destruction of Europe’s economy during the 2nd World War, this course will focus solely on the post-war development of the European economy and on the process of European economic integration. With this focus, the course intends to especially highlight the economic effects of European integration beginning with the European Coal and Steel Community in 1952 until the recent Euro crisis in 2009/10 and its aftermath. The genuine purpose and aim of this course is to present European economic integration to students not as an inevitable, smooth process, but as an often very difficult one accompanied by various crises, which so far, however, have all be resolved due to a shared perception amongst member states that European integration provides an overall added value to all member states, for which to achieve sometimes also sacrifices are necessary to make. The applied perspective of the course is an economic historical one, focusing particularly on issues how living standards and living conditions of Europeans have changed due to the European project.
到達目標: Students are to acquire a broad general knowledge about the European Union’s economic development from the 1950s until today. Students should know the main steps of European economic integration and should be able to explain the main economic effects of this integration process. Students should become aware of the many difficulties and obstacles with which the EU and its member states have been constantly confronted with in their efforts to further pursue European integration. This knowledge should enable students also to put economic cooperation and integration in other world regions for instance South-East Asia (ASEAN) better into perspective.
授業方法: Lecture format. PPP presentation. Students are expected to work on the prep work for each class before coming to class.

第1回: Leaving war-time destruction behind: The establishment of the Organization for European Economic Cooperation - Marshall Plan
第2回: The European Coal and Steel Community and the economic recovery in the 1950s
第3回: The long way to the Treaties of Rome (Issues, disputes and outcomes)
第4回: Towards a Common Agricultural Policy and the formation of the Customs Union - The European economy in the 1960s
第5回: EFTA - The British challenge to the European Economic Communities (EEC)
第6回: Excursus: Behind the Iron Curtain - Planned economy and the COMECON
第7回: The economic crisis of the 1970s and the establishment of the European Monetary System (EMS)
第8回: From Eurosclerosis to a restart of European integration - the European economy in the 1980s
第9回: Towards the Single Market: The European economy in the 1990s
第10回: The Collapse of the Socialist economic system and economic reforms in the CEE countries
第11回: The European Monetary Union and the introduction of the common currency
第12回: Adjusting to new global economic realities - European economies from the introduction of the Euro to the World Financial Crisis
第13回: The Euro crisis and its implications
第14回: Instead of a summary: The EU Economy beyond Europe 2020
